title: Climate Protesters Carried and Led Away by Police, Following Melbourne Sit-In
text:
Dozens of protesters aligned with climate change activist group Extinction Rebellion, were carried or led away by police during a sit-in demonstration in Melbourne, Victoria, on October 8.

The climate change protesters staged the sit-in on Spring Street, outside The Old Treasury Building. The sit-in protesters were surrounded by police and eventually carried or voluntarily led away by authorities, as seen in the video shared to Facebook by Extinction Rebellion Australia.

It was the second demonstration in Melbourne after protests were held on Monday as part of a string of activist events planned for International Rebellion Week. Credit: Extinction Rebellion Australia via Storyful
